SENT.plain: We report a 19-year-old woman with Behcet's disease who suffered a subarachnoid hemorrhage and had bilateral peripheral middle cerebral artery aneurysms
After steroid therapy for 3 days, the smaller aneurysm disappeared
The larger aneurysm was excised and the artery reconstructed using a superficial temporary artery graft
Histological examination showed vasculitis restricted to the wall of the aneurysm
This is the first report of arterial reconstruction for an aneurysm associated with Behcet's disease
Steroid therapy before the operation may facilitate repair of the arterial wall
